stream_context.summary: Kaze focused almost the entire stream on prototyping the new Bowser flagship boss fight: getting Bowser to walk, step up slopes, be grabbed by the tail, be thrown off the ship, return, and increase speed each cycle.  Along the way he fixed a Resnor lighting/rig issue, imported Biobak’s new tutorial-bunny model, and tested pop-in, collision and performance optimisations.

development_findings.summary: Bowser boss fight core loop defined: Bowser slowly walks toward Mario, can be grabbed by the tail, spun and thrown off the airship; after each throw he jumps (or is pulled by a Lakitu) back to his castle and the cycle speeds up.
development_findings.quote: The idea here is gonna be that you have to grab Bowser's tail and throw him off the ship … the first time has to be very easy and then it has to get faster and faster.

development_findings.summary: Implemented Bowser walk cycle placeholder, slope step-up logic (20→50 units) and run-cycle speed scaling with damage; still needs proper animation and a Lakitu return sequence.

Fixed a long-standing collision optimisation: kept surface sorting but culls floors that are too high, allowing the engine to iterate only 0x10 bytes per surface and halve D-cache loads; uses imaginary-number GCC trick for faster sin/cos.
development_findings.quote: Since we need to fix floor clacking … what if we keep the sorting priority and kill all the floors that are too high, then we only load the upper Y and lower Y; that’s very good.

development_findings.summary: Daily micro-optimisations continue; Kaze postpones a standalone SM64 build until RTYI is complete to avoid duplicating work.
development_findings.quote: It makes no sense to try and make a Mario 64 version now and then have to apply all the optimisations I find to two things at once.

development_findings.summary: ROM currently 44.6 MB, of which 32.1 MB is streamed music; streamed tracks sound better but dominate size budget under 64 MB limit.
Pop-in on background airships mitigated by scaling-in objects, negative scaling with front-face culling, and optional stylised ‘rise from ground’ effect for distant actors.
Resnor mini-boss overhauled: new rig, higher-res textures, world shading; fixed 30 FPS animation bug caused by DeltaCurrentRot misuse.
Imported Biobak’s new tutorial-bunny sign models; initial matrix issue (signs bounced each frame) traced to improper interpolation call and corrected.
New Mario movement refinements (long-jump chaining, triple-jump land cancel, aerial kicks) demonstrated; requires a forthcoming “new animation format” Zeina is building.

context_findings.summary: Kaze moved streaming permanently to YouTube after polls showed strong preference and because YouTube’s 70/30 revenue split beats Twitch’s 50/50 and eliminates intrusive ads.
context_findings.quote: If you donate on Twitch, Jeff Bezos gets 50 % of that money … YouTube is 70-30, that’s another good reason to switch.

context_findings.summary: Design philosophy: minimise player options; believes too many settings reduce satisfaction and fragment the experience.
context_findings.quote: Options are bad.  You don't want to give your players too much choice.

context_findings.summary: Programming background: began on a calculator at age 12, claims 15 years experience and a ‘born ability’ for coding.
context_findings.quote: I literally was just born with the ability to code … coding skill and coding knowledge are two very different things.

context_findings.summary: Currently has a paid Unreal Engine day job; RTYI is part-time alongside Patreon/YouTube income; saving toward a house.
Personal life glimpses: German living in Canada; parents mailed favourite German cereal and chocolate; values work–life-stream balance.
Strong opinions on industry code quality: ‘good code’ often sacrificed so average programmers can contribute in commercial studios.
context_findings.quote: Bad programmers are not gonna be able to work with good code, so the industry discourages writing good code.

context_findings.summary: Openly dismisses adding extensive accessibility modes (e.g., blind support) given platform constraints.
context_findings.quote: If you're blind, you shouldn't be playing Mario 64, a platformer game.

biobak.summary: Delivered new tutorial-bunny model using dual 48×48 textures plus 80×84 sheet; Kaze imported and debugged it.

zeina.summary: Primary animator; produced updated Bowser model with new rig, textures, and ~70 fewer triangles; will build the new universal animation format.
zeina.quote: Yes, I have a YouTube channel.  You'll see Bowser's showcase next.

key_stories.title: Bowser Boss Fight Prototype
key_stories.summary: Kaze spent the stream turning a ‘Roomba’ placeholder into a functional boss: walk cycle, slope climbing, tail-grab hitbox, throw physics, dust effects and speed scaling.
key_stories.challenge: Bowser previously floated aimlessly and couldn’t navigate ramps or be grabbed.
key_stories.process: Added step-up physics, tail hitbox, release logic, debugged rotation & translation bugs, and planned Lakitu return animation.
key_stories.outcome: First full loop playable (though animations placeholder); fight feels promising and sets direction for final polish.
key_stories.key_quote: The idea is you grab Bowser's tail, throw him off the ship, and each phase gets faster.

key_stories.title: Surface-sorting Optimisation Breakthrough
key_stories.summary: Kaze realised he could restore Mario 64’s original surface-priority sort, then cull unseen floors, cutting cache misses.
key_stories.challenge: Mario 64’s hacky sort caused ‘floor cocking’; Kaze’s earlier fix removed sorting but slowed look-ups.
key_stories.process: Re-enabled sorting, killed too-high floors, packed struct to 0x10 bytes, used imaginary-number GCC trick.
key_stories.outcome: Faster collision lookup and the ‘most correct sine & cosine function’ implemented.
key_stories.key_quote: We only load the upper Y and lower Y; we prevent loading the rest, which is very good.

key_stories.title: Tutorial Bunny Model Bug
key_stories.summary: Biobak’s new sign model bounced wildly in-game.
key_stories.challenge: Matrix offset caused signs to hop every frame.
key_stories.process: Traced to spawned objects’ interpolated position not being set when using a supposedly safe helper; refactored spawn logic.
key_stories.outcome: Signs now render correctly and await animation pass.
key_stories.key_quote: It was using this function, which I thought was safe— it wasn’t.
